com.nitnelave.CreeperHeal.utils

Class NeighborFinder<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nitnelave.CreeperHeal.utils.NeighborFinder<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the data stored for each point.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NeighborDateLoc, NeighborExplosion, NeighborFire

    public abstract class NeighborFinder<T>
extends Object
    2-D map, allowing for fast neighbor search. The map is divided in zones, and in each zone there is a list of Location.
    Author:
    nitnelave

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NeighborFinder()

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods

      void addElement(T el, double x, double y)
      Add an element to the map.
      abstract void clean()
      Clean the map by removing useless elements in zones, and empty zones.
      void clear()
      Clear the map of all elements.

      Get a neighbor of the location provided.
      boolean hasNeighbor(org.bukkit.Location loc)
      Get whether the location is "close" to an element.

      Get whether the map is completely empty (no zones).

    • Constructor Detail

      • NeighborFinder

        public NeighborFinder()

    • Method Detail

      • addElement

        public void addElement(T el,
                       double x,
                       double y)
        Add an element to the map. It is placed in the correct zone, created if necessary.
        Parameters:
        el - The element.
        x - The x coordinate.
        y - The y coordinate.

      • removeElement

        public void removeElement(T el,
                          double x,
                          double y)
        Remove an element from the map. It must be in the zone at the x, y coordinate.
        Parameters:
        el - The element to remove.
        x - The x coordinate for the zone.
        y - The y coordinate for the zone.

      • hasNeighbor

        public boolean hasNeighbor(org.bukkit.Location loc)
        Get whether the location is "close" to an element. The actual definition of "close" is in the overridden methods of the children classes.
        Parameters:
        loc - The point to check for neighbors.
        Returns:
        Whether the location is close to an element.

      • getNeighbor

        public T getNeighbor(org.bukkit.Location loc)
        Get a neighbor of the location provided. It is not guaranteed to be the closest, but it is an element which satisfies the condition of a neighbor.
        Parameters:
        loc - The location to check for neighbors.
        Returns:
        A neighboring element, null if no such element exists.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Get whether the map is completely empty (no zones).
        Returns:
        Whether the map is empty.

      • clean

        public abstract void clean()
        Clean the map by removing useless elements in zones, and empty zones.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clear the map of all elements.
